item.title: Auto Skillcapes
item.dc:creator: @omg_ffs_ownd omg ffs ownd
item.description:
@omg_ffs_ownd wrote:

yea but make sure to put == not =, = assigns a value, == checks to see if a variable is equal to what your having it check. so, its checking to see if for example attack is equal to 99, and if so…add the items.

Read full topic

item.title: Auto Skillcapes
item.dc:creator: @sexytimee sexytimee
item.description:
@sexytimee wrote:

If i changed it to playerLevel[skill] how would it know which cape to give to the player?

Here’s the rest that i have. I need to add mage and others but i don’t know the playerLevel number.

[code]if(playerLevel[1] > 98) {
addItem(14080, 1);
addItem(14081, 1);

}

if(playerLevel[2] > 98) {
addItem(14077, 1);
addItem(14078, 1);

}

if(playerLevel[3] > 98) {
addItem(14095, 1);
addItem(14096, 1);

}

if(playerLevel[0] > 98) {
addItem(14074, 1);
addItem(14075, 1);

}

if(playerLevel[4] > 98) {
addItem(14083, 1);
addItem(14084, 1);

}
[/code]

item.description:
@omg_ffs_ownd wrote:

is this the only auto skillcape code you have so far? if not show the rest so we can see more of whats going on. thanks!

also, just change it to playerLevel[skill] == 99 i just think thats better.

item.title: Auto Skillcapes
item.dc:creator: @sexytimee sexytimee
item.description:
@sexytimee wrote:

I have created a code which adds your cape when you get to 99 in a certain level. This is what I have:

[code]if(playerLevel[0] > 98) {
addItem(14074, 1);
addItem(14075, 1);

}[/code]

The only problem with this is say they have 99 attack. If they level something liek smithing they also get the attack cape. So every 99 stat you get and you lvl something else you get all your 99 capes again. Does anyone have some suggestions?

Thanks.

ps: if you have the skill ids like skill 0= attack. that would be great.

Read full topic
